pageContext.claim: “Insurance is, you’re 20 years old, you just graduated from college, and you start paying $15 a month for the rest of your life and by the time you’re 70, and you really need it, you’re still paying the same amount.”
pageContext.analysis: As The Washington Post's health policy reporter Paige Winfield Cunningham notes: "That’s not the way insurance works, unless you regulate insurers (which Republicans generally don’t want to do). Older people pay higher premiums because they cost insurers more."
